webResultsPreview.title: open source - What's the best structure for a repository? - Software Engineering Stack Exchange
webResultsPreview.snippet: Reserve your root for misc bits (so you have a place for misc related directories and files which may be valuable to store in your repository), start your source tree one level down.

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub - kriasoft/Folder-Structure-Conventions: Folder / directory structure options and naming conventions for software projects
webResultsPreview.snippet: Folder / directory structure options and naming conventions for software projects - kriasoft/Folder-Structure-Conventions

webResultsPreview.title: COIN-OR Developer's Guide | COIN-OR Documentation
webResultsPreview.snippet: Dependencies are indicated by maintaining a file called Dependencies in the root of your repository. This is used by the coinbrew script, among others, to determine what additional projects are needed. The format of the file is lines consisting of a short name for the project, a URL, and (in the case of a git dependency), a branch name.

webResultsPreview.title: What is a top level folder?
webResultsPreview.snippet: If you delete a top-level folder ... folder is stored in a separate folder on the server side using the following convention: RepositoryPath\UsersLoginEmail\ProfileName\TopLevelFolder...

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub - webworker01/coins: coin parameters and all files needed for GUI support
webResultsPreview.snippet: "pubtype", "p2shtype", and "wiftype" is the also very specific information about coin's parameters. This is specific to Bitcoin Protocol compatible coins only, and such information can be found in source code of the project. These parameters information can be expected in files like src/init.cpp, src/base58.h, and src/chainparamsbase.h if the project is following the bitcoin source code directory/files structure.

search for Monero vs Bitcoin

results.title: The Merits of Monero: Why Monero vs Bitcoin
results.snippet: Furthermore, the always-on nature of Monero‚Äôs privacy features means that even if the majority of Monero users are not privacy sensitive, they will still automatically participate with the strengthening of the privacy mechanisms for other users that are privacy conscious. ‚ÄòMining‚Äô is the name given to running a program on a computer which verifies and processes the cryptocurrency transactions that other people announce to the worldwide network. We believe the creators of Bitcoin chose poorly when it came to their mining algorithm.

results.title: Monero vs. Bitcoin: Which is better in 2025? | Academy Guarda.com
results.snippet: Bitcoin remains the dominant cryptocurrency, with widespread institutional support, robust infrastructure, and recognition as ‚Äúdigital gold.‚Äù Its transparent blockchain, however, limits privacy, which could be a concern as global regulations tighten. Monero, on the other hand, excels in privacy and fungibility, offering unmatched anonymity with features like ring signatures and stealth addresses.

results.title: Monero vs. Bitcoin: The Ultimate Comparison
results.snippet: While Bitcoin's transactions are pseudonymous, meaning they are not directly linked to real-world identities, the blockchain's transparency allows for traceability. Monero, on the other hand, takes privacy to a whole new level. Launched in 2014, Monero is designed to be truly private and ...

results.title: Monero vs Bitcoin: What Are the Main Differences? The Ultimate Comparison
results.snippet: In conclusion, one of the most interesting features of Monero is that it is less volatile than other crypto assets; some even refer to it as being the ‚Äòstable cryptocurrency.‚Äô ¬∑ Bitcoin (BTC) is the first and most well-known cryptocurrency, created in 2009 by an anonymous person or group using the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto.

results.title: Monero vs Bitcoin fees
results.snippet: Bitcoin transaction fees are generally higher than Monero due to the fixed block size limit in Bitcoin. When the number of transactions exceeds the block size limit, users have to compete by offering higher fees to prioritize their transactions. This bidding war for limited space in blocks ...

results.title: Monero XMR vs Bitcoin BTC: Which Cryptocurrency Offers the Best Privacy and Value? | SimpleSwap
results.snippet: Serving as the world's first cryptocurrency, Bitcoin utilizes blockchain technology to safeguard and authenticate transactions, setting the standard for digital currencies worldwide. Contrary to BTC transparent blockchain, Monero operates on a blockchain designed to prioritize anonymity.

results.title: Monero vs. Bitcoin: Full Comparison | Exolix
results.snippet: Owing to the fact that all Bitcoin transactions are absolutely transparent, some BTC might become blacklisted by exchanges as long as any trace of money could be followed to ill intentions. Therefore, Bitcoin is not strictly fungible, since coins can be differentiated between each other given their particular history. Monero makes sure that every XMR coin is identical and untraceable, hence fully fungible.

results.title: Monero (XMR) Cryptocurrency: Definition, Mining, vs. Bitcoin
results.snippet: Monero is more scalable, as it can handle more transactions per second. Bitcoin and Monero both validate new blocks of transactions and expand their blockchains with a mining-based Proof-of-Work (PoW) consensus mechanism.

results.title: r/Monero on Reddit: What are the main differences of Monero and Bitcoin?
results.snippet: Another big advantage to monero is that literally anyone can mine it since the PoW algorithm works best on regular CPUs (making it more decentralized, also truer to the one-cpu-one-vote concept). Bitcoin on the other hand is mainly mined by ASIC (i.e. expensive custom processors made only to mine btc).

results.title: Monero: What It Means, How It Works, and Features
results.snippet: Monero is a digital currency that offers a high level of anonymity for users and their transactions. Like Bitcoin, Monero is a decentralized peer-to-peer cryptocurrency, but unlike Bitcoin, Monero is characterized as a more anonymous or privacy-oriented virtual currency.

data.title: My Secret Lasagna Recipe Without The Carbs!
data.summary: Summary: A professional chef adapts lasagna to a carnivore/keto style, creating a tomato-free ‚Äúred‚Äù meat sauce thickened with tempered egg yolks and parmesan. He layers a 9x9 dish with a mozzarella-parmesan blend, a ricotta layer, and thick-sliced deli chicken as noodle substitutes, then bakes at 350¬∞F for 45 minutes and rests 20 minutes. The result is a rich, filling lasagna that avoids traditional pasta and tomato products, with options for different ‚Äúnoodle‚Äù layers. He notes his carnivore journey, weight loss, and asks viewers about preferred salts. Key Points:
keyPoints: Sauce body achieved by tempering egg yolks with hot sauce and adding shredded parmesan.
Layers use shredded mozzarella, parmesan, and a ricotta layer; dish brushed with grass-fed butter.
Noodle substitutes include thick-sliced deli chicken (suggested turkey, roast beef, or egg wraps).
Built three layers high in a 9x9 pan; bake at 350¬∞F for 45 minutes and rest 20 minutes before slicing.
Emphasizes speed (no noodle cooking) and using minimal-preservative ingredients.
data.whyMatters: This demonstrates how classic comfort foods can be adapted for carnivore or keto diets without sacrificing texture or flavor. It also highlights practical techniques (tempering eggs, resting time) that improve results in low-carb cooking.
